verses.verse: Afterward <WH310> <WH3651> Job <WH347> opened <WH6605> his mouth <WH6310> and cursed <WH7043> the day <WH3117> of his [birth.]
And Job <WH347> said, <WH6030> <WH559>
"Let the day <WH3117> perish on which I was to be born, <WH6> And the night <WH3205> [which] said, <WH3915> 'A boy <WH559> is conceived. <WH1397>'
"May that day <WH3117> be darkness; <WH2822> Let not God <WH433> above <WH4605> care <WH1875> for it, Nor <WH408> light <WH5105> shine <WH3313> on it.
"Let darkness <WH2822> and black <WH6757> gloom <WH6757> claim <WH1350> it; Let a cloud <WH6053> settle <WH7931> on it; Let the blackness <WH3650> of the day <WH3117> terrify <WH1204> it.

"[As for] that night, <WH3915> let darkness <WH652> seize <WH3947> it; Let it not rejoice <WH2302> among the days <WH3117> of the year; <WH8141> Let it not come <WH935> into the number <WH4557> of the months. <WH3391>
"Behold, <WH2009> let that night <WH3915> be barren; <WH1565> Let no <WH408> joyful <WH7445> shout <WH7445> enter <WH935> it.
"Let those curse <WH6895> it who curse <WH779> the day, <WH3117> Who are prepared <WH6264> to rouse <WH5782> Leviathan. <WH3882>

"Let the stars <WH3556> of its twilight <WH5399> be darkened; <WH2821> Let it wait <WH6960> for light <WH216> but have <WH369> none, <WH369> Neither <WH408> let it see <WH7200> the breaking <WH6079> dawn; <WH7837>
Because <WH3588> it did not shut <WH5462> the opening <WH1817> of my [mother's] womb, <WH990> Or hide <WH5641> trouble <WH5999> from my eyes. <WH5869>
"Why <WH4100> did I not die <WH4191> at birth, <WH7358> Come <WH3318> forth <WH3318> from the womb <WH990> and expire <WH1478>?
"Why <WH4069> did the knees <WH1290> receive <WH6923> me, And why <WH4100> the breasts, <WH7699> that I should suck <WH3243>?
"For now <WH6258> I would have lain <WH7901> down <WH7901> and been <WH8252> quiet; <WH8252> I would have slept <WH3462> then, <WH227> I would have been <WH5117> at rest, <WH5117>
With kings <WH4428> and [with] counselors <WH3289> of the earth, <WH776> Who rebuilt <WH1129> ruins <WH2723> for themselves;
Or <WH176> with princes <WH8269> who had gold, <WH2091> Who were filling <WH4390> their houses <WH1004> [with] silver. <WH3701>
"Or <WH176> like a miscarriage <WH5309> which is discarded, <WH2934> I would not be, As infants <WH5768> that never <WH3808> saw <WH7200> light. <WH216>
"There <WH8033> the wicked <WH7563> cease <WH2308> from raging, <WH7267> And there <WH8033> the weary <WH3019> are at rest. <WH5117>
"The prisoners <WH615> are at ease <WH7599> together; <WH3162> They do not hear <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of the taskmaster. <WH5065>
"The small <WH9512> and the great <WH1419> are there, <WH8033> And the slave <WH5650> is free <WH2670> from his master. <WH113>
"Why <WH4100> is light <WH216> given <WH5414> to him who <WH9416> suffers, <WH9416> And life <WH9132> to the bitter <WH4751> of soul; <WH5315>
Who long <WH2442> for death, <WH4194> but there <WH369> is none, <WH369> And dig <WH2658> for it more <WH4480> than <WH4480> for hidden <WH4301> treasures; <WH4301>
Who rejoice <WH8056> greatly, <WH413> <WH1524> They exult <WH7797> when <WH3588> they find <WH4672> the grave <WH6913>?
"[Why is light given] to a man <WH1397> whose <WH834> way <WH1870> is hidden, <WH5641> And whom God <WH433> has hedged <WH9353> in?
"For my groaning <WH585> comes <WH935> at the sight <WH6440> of my food, <WH3899> And my cries <WH7581> pour <WH5413> out like water. <WH4325>
"For what <WH6343> I fear <WH6342> comes <WH857> upon me, And what <WH834> I dread <WH3025> befalls <WH935> me.
"I am not at ease, <WH7951> nor <WH3808> am I quiet, <WH8252> And I am not at rest, <WH5117> but turmoil <WH7267> comes. <WH935>"
